intro: Barleria marginata, commonly known as the African marguerite or blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive blue-gray coloration. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Barleria marginata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
